instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3330B A1286 No İmage
threads.message: There is sound but there isn't video. On 3rd and 4th legs of J9000, there were short circuits, I cleaned them and made another path. On 4th leg there is 3.3 volts but there isn't any on 2nd & 3rd. So, I backtracked and checked U9000. On its 2nd & 3rd legs, there are 3.3 volts but there is no voltage on lcd_pwr_en. On the same path there is no voltage on first leg of R9678. In this case, should I replace U9000?

threads.title: 820-3330B A1286 No İmage
threads.message:
No matter problem found on 820-3330 board, you need to resolder U8900 with leaded solder.
Is a preventive measure, which can also be related with your particular problem.

Do you get external video?

Check R9010/11, their traces and solders.
Post voltage and diode mode to ground at CLK/DATA lines.
Be sure video connector and cable are good; test with another LCD assembly.

BTW, use "pin" instead of "leg" for electronic components...

threads.title: 820-3330B A1286 No İmage
threads.message:
i did gpu disabled software uma  3 months ago

[URL]https://realmacmods.com/macbook-2011-radeon-gpu-disable/[/URL]  "3 months ago"

check it R9010/11 No problem 100K
CLK/DATA = 0,517
I tried the screen on another device it works


We always say leg in Turkey, but I will say pin for you.  :)

threads.title: 820-3330B A1286 No İmage
threads.message:
Does that mod survive to PRAM reset?

PCH needs to talk first with LCD through DDC bus, via U9270.
Check if that MUX chip is correctly controlled.

U9270 I change it but same
sound on no screen no backlight

threads.title: 820-3330B A1286 No İmage
threads.message:
I didn't say to change it.
Post voltage for pins 5 & 6.

threads.title: 820-3330B A1286 No İmage
threads.message:
pins 5 & 6. no voltage  (lcd not plugged in)
pins 5 & 6. no voltage  (lcd plugged in)

threads.title: 820-3330B A1286 No İmage
threads.message:
Pins 5/12 must be high, when iGPU enabled.
Of course 6/13 must be low at same time; discrete GPU disabled.
GMUX (U9600) is still in place?

BTW, no reason to measure video/backlight signals without LCD connected!

threads.title: 820-3330B A1286 No İmage
threads.message: GMUX (U9600) is still in place? Yes

threads.title: 820-3330B A1286 No İmage
threads.message: GMUX (U9600) is still in place?  yes I did not do anything

threads.title: 820-3330B A1286 No İmage
threads.message:
Then you have a problem in that area.
GMUX controlls DDC MUX.
Re-check all work done for GPU disable.

threads.title: 820-3330B A1286 No İmage
threads.message: Before I made uma, device was turning on with a green screen. After the uma, there was no problem, it turned on. But,  a piece of solder stuck on lcd pins and it caused it to short circuit, so I get no image now. SMC reset is enough to cancel UMA. I cancelled it, there are 3.3 volts on the 6th pin of U9270 but still I get no image, no light, nothing...

threads.title: 820-3330B A1286 No İmage
threads.message:
Pin 6 high means now GPU is enabled.
So there is a GPU related issue.
What mod did you use to disable GPU?

threads.title: 820-3330B A1286 No İmage
threads.message: [URL unfurl="true"]https://realmacmods.com/macbook-2011-radeon-gpu-disable/[/URL]

threads.title: 820-3330B A1286 No İmage
threads.message: GPU was already malfunctioning but there was image. When UMA was cancelled, it turned on with a green screen as I stated but, I don't think GPU is the problem right now because there is no image, nothing. Before, GPU was offline and there was no image again. I cancelled UMA as you instructed.

threads.title: 820-3330B A1286 No İmage
threads.message:
You've said to have 3330 board (2012), not 2915 (2011).

Some information available here.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]

threads.title: 820-3330B A1286 No İmage
threads.message:
That LCD connector MUST be changed.
Video cable could be damaged too, inspect it with microscope.
If GPU is still in use, check for external video.

i changed the lcd socket, I didn't think it had anything to do with it,
There is an image on the external screen.

threads.title: 820-3330B A1286 No İmage
threads.message:
"I didn't think it had anything to do with it"
It is damaged; do you really think that one made good contacts???
Post voltage for pins 4, 6, 7.

Video cable is still good?
Did you try known good LCD assembly?

Check L9010/11 continuity.

threads.title: 820-3330B A1286 No İmage
threads.message:
Check traces from U9270 to J9000.
Post U9270 voltages, with internal LCD connected.

threads.title: 820-3330B A1286 No İmage
threads.message:
Check traces from U9270 to J9000. = I checked the line it's ok

U9270
pin1 = 3.3 Volt
pin2&3 = 3.3 Volt
pin4 = 3.3 Volt
pin5&12 = No Voltage
pin6&13 = 3.3 Volt
pin7 = gnd
pin8 = 3.3 volt
pin9&10 = 3.3 volt
pin 11 = 3.3 volt
pin14 = 3.3 Volt

threads.title: 820-3330B A1286 No İmage
threads.message:
Looks like discrete graphics is selected.
You may have a problem with GMUX (U9600), or bad communication with internal LCD.
